perturbation.original_text: i-on will maintain the operation of the Hosted Site continuously, twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week, including holidays, with the exception of reasonable hardware and software maintenance that must be performed on the Hosting Computer and/or the Hosted Site. i-on will use best efforts to schedule and perform such maintenance between the hours of 8pm and 8am Eastern Standard Time on weekdays, or during weekends.
perturbation.changed_text: i-on will maintain the operation of the Hosted Site continuously, twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week, including holidays. i-on will perform maintenance as needed.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies maintenance scheduling. Removing the specified scheduling timeframe creates ambiguity. Later clauses referring to 'reasonable maintenance' now lack a clear definition of what is reasonable, leading to potential disputes about service uptime and permissible maintenance windows. The lack of defined timeframes can then affect the Customer's business as they wouldn't have a good idea when their webpage will be down for maintenance.

perturbation.original_text: use of the Microsoft SQL Server 6.5 or higher database server software for the Hosted Site, within the boundaries of allocated computer storage, per #5 above;
perturbation.changed_text: use of database server software for the Hosted Site;
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific software (Microsoft SQL Server 6.5 or higher) and referencing allocated computer storage (#5 above), the agreement becomes vague. If #5 which defines computer storage gets removed, the clause will have little to no meaning.
perturbation.location: SERVICES PROVIDED TO THE CUSTOMER, point 10

perturbation.original_text: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 5th day of each month beginning in April 1, 1999. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
perturbation.changed_text: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines the amount and due date of the payment. Removing the specific amount ($450) and due date (5th of each month beginning April 1, 1999) creates ambiguity about the financial obligations. Although it still mentions 'recurring monthly fee', without a defined amount, it's unenforceable. It contradicts the expectation of a clear financial agreement because payment details are no longer concretely defined.
